Dear Marci Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior Management
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/26/23, youth and staff were involved in a physical altercation
which resulted in youth hitting their head on a toilet and sustaining
a laceration to the forehead.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/28/2023 and
reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at school on 3/1/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported law
enforcement is at the facility all the time, at least a couple times a
week. On Sunday Youth A approached Staff 2 in a “joking
manner” and Staff 2 took her seriously. Staff 2 went into the
medication room where Staff 1 was sitting at the desk. Youth A
heard Staff 1 call her a “brat”. Youth A went into the medication
room and told Staff 1 to “shut up” and “don’t talk to me” in a “joking
manner” and Staff 1 took her serious. Youth A went into the
medication room bathroom and closed the door. Staff 1 opened
the bathroom door on Youth A and asked Youth A what her issue
2

was. Youth A reported when Staff 1 opened the door, Youth A
held it closed while she stood up from using the bathroom and
pulled up her pants. Youth A began putting hand sanitizer and
lotion on the sink counter and flicked water at Staff 1’s face while
Staff 1 stood in the bathroom doorway. Staff 1 ignored Youth A
and just starred at her. Youth A squirted lotion on the bathroom
floor and a little got on Staff 1’s shoe. Staff 1 walked into the
bathroom and pushed Youth A against the mirror in the bathroom.
Staff 1 told Youth A “no one is going to believe you”. Staff 1 was
holding Youth A’s arms. Youth A pushed Staff 1 away from her.
Staff 1 put her hands in a fist by Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 took
everything off the counter in the bathroom and put it outside the
bathroom. Staff 1 bent over to wipe lotion off her shoe and Youth
A told Staff 1 she should punch her. Staff 1 told Youth A if she hit
her, Staff 1 would put her in a restraint. Youth A realized at this
time Staff 1 just put her hands on her as Youth A reported Staff 1
pushed her against the mirror. Youth A reported she hit Staff 1 in
the face while Staff 1 was bent over wiping the lotion off her shoe.
Youth A did not recall how she hit Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff
1 began coming at her pushing and shoving her. Staff 1 pushed
Youth A’s head down while Youth A was laying back on the toilet.
Youth A's head hit the back of the toilet tank. Youth A reported
having a bump on the back of her head from this. Youth A
reported Staff 1 was not trying to put her into a restraint. Youth A
told Staff 1 to get off her. Youth A was kicking at Staff 1 as Staff 1
was pushing her head down. Staff 2 entered the room at this time.
Youth A stood up from the toilet and Staff 1 placed her in a
standing restraint. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed her against
the bathroom counter in the restraint causing her to get a bruise
on her lower waist/hip area. Staff 2 told Staff 1 to let go. Youth A
began pinching Staff 1 on the side while in the restraint. Youth A
continued pinching Staff 1 and Staff 1 slammed her against the
counter and said, “keep fucking pinching me.” Staff 2 told Staff 1
to let go. Youth A could not recall how Staff 1 was holding her
during this time when she pushed her into the counter. Staff 1 let
go of Youth A. Youth A reported she blacked out and was crying.
Youth A reported Staff 1 cusses at the youth. Youth A reported
having a bruise on her left forearm from Staff 1 holding her arms,
a bruise on her upper right thigh, bruising on her lower stomach/
hip area from being shoved into the bathroom counter, and a
bump on the back of her head. Youth A denied medical treatment
when offered by law enforcement as well as when asked during
the interview. Youth A reported youth are treated differently at the
facility and provided the example of Youth B receiving special
items from Staff 5.
3

Youth B was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 3/3/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported all the
youth were in the living room watching a movie. Youth B went into
the medication room where Staff 1 was working at the desk to ask
her a question. Youth A followed Youth B into the medication
room. Staff 2 was also in the medication room. Youth A said
“dumb ass” to Staff 1 as a joke. Staff 1 did not take it as a joke.
Youth A went into the bathroom in the medication room. Youth B
reported youth are not allowed in the medication room bathroom.
Staff 1 opened the bathroom door and stood in the doorway.
Youth A had lotion in her hands. Staff 1 took a box of items out of
the bathroom. Staff 1 told Youth A to stop what she was doing.
Youth B and Staff 2 left the medication room at this time. Youth B
did not see anything else until Staff 1 exited from the medication
room. Youth B reported Staff 1 came out of the medication room
with a box of stuff and stated Youth A had broken her phone.
Youth B reported she has seen Staff 1 restrain youth and has no
concerns with the restraints she has witnessed. Youth B reported
Staff 1 does not cuss at or in front of youth. Youth B reported she
heard Staff 1 tell Youth A “stop being childish.” Youth B reported
the medication room bathroom is usually closed and locked.
Youth are only able to use the medication bathroom if it is an
emergency and all the other bathrooms in the house are in use.
Youth C was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 3/3/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C reported Staff 1
was in the medication room and Youth A went into the medication
room and began cussing. Youth C reported Youth A was joking
however Staff 1 did not take it as a joke. Youth C reported she
heard Youth A yelling and screaming from the medication room.
Youth C was unable to tell if Youth A was saying something when
she was yelling. Staff 1 came out of the medication room with a
box of stuff. Staff 1 has not been back to work since. Youth C
reported she has witnessed Staff 1 do restraints and has no
concerns with the restraints she has seen. Staff 1 doesn’t usually
swear at youth however sometimes she will when she is joking
with youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams Meeting on 3/3/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 was in the
medication room on Sunday working on her computer. The youth
were just starting their day. Youth B came into the medication
room to talk to Staff 1 about taking a shower. Staff 1 heard Staff 2
talking to Youth A. Staff 2 was heard saying “I am not doing this
right now.” Youth A came into the medication room and told Staff
1 to “shut the fuck up.” Youth A approached Staff 1 at the desk
4

and was breathing on her. Staff 1 ignored Youth A’s behavior and
continued talking to Youth B. Staff 1 noticed the bathroom door in
the medication room was open. Youth A went into the bathroom.
Staff 1 was concerned about Youth A being in the bathroom as
the bathroom is supposed to be closed and not accessible to
youth. Staff 1 was concerned due to their being a spray bottle of
bleach and a box of items on the bathroom counter. Staff 1
reported the bathroom door was still open and Youth A could be
seen picking up a bottle of lotion off the bathroom counter. Staff 1
reported Youth A was not using the bathroom. Staff 1 approached
the bathroom door. At one point Youth A closed the bathroom
door and pinned herself against the bathroom door. Staff 1 could
not recall at what point this occurred. Staff 1 reported she pushed
the door open. Staff 1 asked Youth A what she was doing. Youth
A flicked water at Staff 1’s face. Youth A picked up the squeeze
bottle of lotion and began squirting it at her. The lotion landed on
Staff 1’s leg and shoe. Youth A was laughing. Staff 1 grabbed
the lotion out of Youth A’s hand. Youth A began squirting hand
sanitizer at Staff 1. Staff 1 asked Youth A why she was doing this.
Staff 1 stepped into the bathroom to take the hand sanitizer from
Youth A. Youth A continued laughing. Staff 1 positioned herself
in the bathroom doorway. Staff 1 bent down to wipe her shoe and
Youth A began hitting her in the back of the head. Youth A stated
“I should beat your ass” to Staff 1. Staff 1 stood up and Youth A
continued trying to hit her. Staff 1 reported she was trying to grab
Youth A’s arms to block the hits and place Youth A in a restraint.
Youth A and Staff 1 both fell over the toilet in the bathroom. Staff
1 attempted to catch Youth A. Youth A fell back when they tripped
over the toilet and hit the back of her head on the back of the toilet
tank. Youth A was screaming that she hit her head. Youth A
continued trying to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 placed Youth A in a SCM
(Safe Crisis Management) standing upper torso restraint. Staff 1
did not see Youth A hit her head however she heard a noise that
sounded like something hit. Staff 1 began yelling for assistance
from other staff. Youth A was pinching Staff 1 on her side while in
the standing upper torso restraint. Youth A was resisting the
restraint and yelling “I am going to beat your ass”. Staff 1 did not
recall when Staff 2 came in to assist but thought it was when she
had Youth A in the standing upper torso restraint. Youth A was
saying she hit her head and had a scratch on her face/ forehead.
Staff 1 reported she did not see any blood on Youth A. Staff 1
reported while she had Youth A in the standing upper torso
restraint it was in front of the mirror in the bathroom where she
was able to look at the mirror and see Youth A’s face. Staff 1 told
Staff 2 she needed to leave the room due to her escalating Youth
A. Staff 2 was attempting to de-escalate Youth A by telling Youth
5

A to calm down so Staff 1 could release her and leave the room.
Staff 2 was in the bathroom with Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 1 was
trying to gradually release Youth A from the restraint however
Youth A kept attempting to hit her. Staff 1 released Youth A and
stepped back allowing Staff 2 to get between her and Youth A.
Staff 1 left the room. Staff 1 reported when she restrained Youth
A, Youth A was yelling “help me” to Staff 2. Youth A was accusing
Staff 1 of hitting her and assaulting her. Staff 1 reported she did
not push Youth A as they tripped on the toilet when she was
attempting to place her in a standing upper torso restraint. While
Youth A was making the accusations against Staff 1, Staff 1 said
“there are cameras and they can see,” Youth A stated, “no one is
going to believe me.” Staff 1 denied making any statements that
there were not cameras in the bathroom, and it was her word
against Youth A’s or anything similar to that nature. Staff 1
reported once Staff 2 came in, Youth A changed from assaulting
Staff 1 to saying she was assaulted by Staff 1. Staff 1 reported
Youth A never hit the front of her head. Staff 1 reported the
standing upper torso restraint was a textbook restraint. Youth A
did not say the restraint was too tight. Staff 1 reported she has a
good rapport with Youth A and she has never restrained Youth A
prior. Youth A has been having difficulties lately and likes to get
into power struggles with staff. Staff 1 removed items from the
bathroom during the situation however there were still items that
Youth A could not have access to in the bathroom. Staff 1 was
concerned as she did not know if there was a sharps box with
needles in the bathroom or what else could be in the bathroom
that Youth A could access. Staff 1 reported SCM trains if there is
immediate harm, to block hits or restrain. Staff 1 reported she
restrained Youth A due to Youth A continuing to try to hit her.
Staff 1 was blocking Youth A’s arms and never had a secure grip
on her arms. Staff 1 denied her hands every being near Youth A’s
neck. Youth A did tell Staff 2 she was choked by Staff 1. Staff 1
denied ever telling Youth A to punch her. Staff 1 reported she did
not “lunge” into the bathroom after Youth A hit her however Staff 1
was shown the video clip and after watching the video clip, Staff 1
reported she could see why it was referred to as a “lunge”. Staff 1
reported she did not swear at Youth A during the incident. Staff 1
reported she does not swear at work as she would get
reprimanded. Staff 1 reported she did not choke Youth A or push
Youth A on to the toilet. Staff 1 denied pushing Youth A into the
bathroom counter at any time during the incident. Staff 1 denied
ever holding Youth A's head down when Youth A was laying back
on the toilet.
6

Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/1/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 was with other
youth in the living room when Youth A approached her and said,
“even though you talked shit about me, will you take me upstairs?”
Staff 2 informed Youth A she was not “doing this” and went into
the medication room where Staff 1 was to ask Staff 1 to take
Youth A upstairs. Staff 2 was asking Staff 1 to take Youth A
upstairs when Youth A entered the medication room and went into
the bathroom. Staff 2 reported youth are not allowed in the
bathroom in the medication room. The bathroom door is usually
closed and locked, however Staff 2 noticed the bathroom door
was open and she did not know why. Staff 2 noticed the
bathroom door was open prior to Youth A entering the bathroom
however did not want to draw attention to the open door prior to
Youth A entering it and closing the door. Staff 1 went and
unlocked the bathroom door with Youth A in it. Staff 1 was telling
Youth A to come out of the bathroom and Youth A was refusing.
Staff 2 left the medication room with Youth B. Staff 2 came back
and saw Youth A sitting on the toilet in a leaning back position
with her head on the back of the toilet while kicking at Staff 1.
Staff 1 had ahold of Youth A’s arms/hands however Staff 2
couldn’t see how Staff 1 was holding Youth A’s arms/hands as
she indicated it was hard to see around Staff 1. Staff 2 told Staff 1
that Youth A needed to be put into a proper restraint. Staff 1
turned Youth A on the toilet to get her feet on the ground and
supported Youth A into a standing position. Youth A was trying to
get out of Staff 1’s hold at which time both Staff 1 and Youth A fell
into the mirror. Staff 1 was able to get Youth A into a SCM
standing upper torso restraint. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 had Youth
A in a correct restraint. Youth A began pinching Staff 1’s side.
Staff 2 held Youth A’s hand to get her to stop pinching Staff 1.
Staff 2 was going to transition Staff 1 out of the restraint as she
recognized Youth A was upset with Staff 1. Staff 2 did not end up
going into a restraint with Youth A. Staff 2 got in between Youth A
and Staff 1 to allow Staff 1 to exit the bathroom. Staff 2 reported
she was initially concerned when she came into the medication
room and saw what was happening as she was not sure how the
situation had escalated. Staff 2 reported she heard Staff 1 say
“There are no cameras in here. No one is going to believe you.
Your word against mine.” Staff 2 did not recall if Staff 1 swore at
Youth A at all during the incident. Staff 2 reported she
accidentally swears at times but not towards the youth. Staff 2 is
not aware of any staff swearing at youth. Staff 2 has witnessed
Staff 1 conduct restraints and reported she has no concerns with
how Staff 1 restrains youth as it is appropriate per the trained
model.
7

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/1/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported she was
upstairs with other youth when the incident occurred however, she
came in at the end. Staff 3 was upstairs and heard banging
noises. Staff 2 was heard saying Staff 1 needed some help. Staff
3 replied to Staff 2 stating she would need a staff to come switch
her out. Staff 2 walked away so Staff 3 continued to remain
upstairs. Staff 4 came upstairs and informed Staff 3 that Staff 1
needed help. As Staff 3 was going down the stairs to the
medication room, Staff 1 came out with a box of items. Staff 1’s
face was red and her voice was trembling. Staff 1 said Youth A hit
her in the face and broke her phone. Staff 3 told Staff 1 to go
outside. Youth A was screaming and crying in the medication
room. Youth A was saying Staff 1 slammed her head on the toilet
and choked her. Youth A claimed Staff 1 said “there is no camera
in her bitch” and hit her head off the toilet. Staff 3 went to
approach Youth A to check her head, Youth A refused to allow her
to check on her. Staff 3 asked Staff 2 what happened in front of
Youth A. Staff 2 said “I don’t know” and Youth A began yelling at
Staff 2 saying “don’t say that you saw.” Staff 2 informed Staff 3
she heard Staff 1 say “there are no cameras in here”. Staff 3 was
able to get Youth A calmed down and offered her ice for her head
and to check her head, Youth A refused. Staff 3 reported she has
never had any concerns with the restraints she has witnessed
Staff 1 do. Staff 1 seems to get into power struggles with youth
and always wants to have the last word. Staff 3 did not hear Staff
1 swear during the incident. Staff 3 has heard Staff 1 swear at
times such as “I am sick of this fucking shit.” Staff 3 has only
worked with Staff 1 for approximately a month as Staff 1 just
began working on first shift.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/1/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 was in the living
room with other youth when she heard commotion. Staff 4 heard
Youth A say, “you just fucking choked me.” Staff 4 and Staff 2
went in the medication room and Staff 2 told Staff 4 to go get Staff
3. Staff 4 saw Youth A and Staff 1 standing by the desk in the
medication room. Staff 1 then left the room and Staff 2 was
keeping Youth A in the medication room. Staff 3 came in and was
attempting to help Staff 2 calm Youth A down. Staff 1 went into
the living room and asked her to get Staff 1’s personal belongings
(coat, phone, computer, and keys) from the medication room. Staff
4 has only seen Staff 1 do one restraint at the facility and did not
have any concerns with the restraint she witnessed. Staff 4 heard
8

Youth A say “don’t you do that” to Staff 2. Staff 4 reported staff do
not swear at or in front of youth at the facility.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 3/1/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker and
via telephone on 3/13/2023. Chief Administrator reported Youth
A has refused medical treatment. The medication room bathroom
door is supposed to be locked as this is not a used bathroom by
youth. Chief Administrator did not know why the door was open
when the incident occurred. Chief Administrator reported youth
are assigned a “primary” which is a support staff that advocates
for the youth at the facility as part of QRTP (Qualified Residential
Treatment Programs). Staff 5 is Youth B’s “primary”. “Primary”
staff assist in getting items for the youth they are assigned such
as birthday presents and taking the youth out for privileges. Chief
Administrator reported Staff 1 has not been back to work since the
incident as Staff 1 was due to recertify for training and did not
attend resulting in Staff 1 being placed on suspension until Staff 1
completes required training. Chief Administrator reported Law
enforcement had been called to the facility more frequently in
January and February due to a couple of specific youth which
have since left the facility. Law enforcement has not been called
to the facility sine 2/26/2023 as of 3/13/2023. Law enforcement
was contacted more frequently in January and February also due
to new staff and changes at the facility including changes in the
Chief Administrator. Since becoming the Chief Administrator, a
new protocol for law enforcement was implemented. Beginning
2/23/2023, the shift supervisor calls the Chief Administrator prior
to calling law enforcement to talk about the situation and
determine if law enforcement should be contacted. Chief
Administrator reported in January and February law enforcement
was contacted for AWOLP (absent without legal permission),
assaults to staff and youth, self-harming behaviors for a youth that
was in and out of the hospital, and destruction of property. Chief
Administrator reported prior to her becoming the Chief
Administrator she felt there were some calls to law enforcement
that were unnecessary. Chief Administrator reported since being
in her role, she is providing more training opportunities to staff
regarding recognizing escalation early on to prevent situations by
reviewing video footage and using real situations at the facility as
in the moment training/teaching for staff.
Isabella County Central Dispatch was interviewed via
telephone on 3/14/2023. Isabella County Central Dispatch
reviewed calls from New Hope facility and reported law
9

enforcement has been contacted by the agency approximately
seventeen times since January 1, 2023, to March 14, 2023.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Video Review:
Video footage of 2/26/2023, in the medication room was reviewed
on 3/1/2023. Youth A goes into the bathroom in the medication
room and closes the door. Staff 1 gets up from the desk and
opens the bathroom door and places her foot in the door. Staff 1
goes into the bathroom. The video camera angle does not allow
the inside of the bathroom to be seen, it is unable to determine
what Staff 1 and Youth A are doing in the bathroom. Staff 1
comes out of the bathroom with a box of stuff. Staff 1 is seen
standing in the bathroom doorway. Staff 1 bends down to wipe
her shoe and stands back up. Staff 1 continues standing in the
doorway and is placing items in the box that were removed from
the bathroom. Staff 1 goes back into the bathroom; it is unable to
be determined what she does. Staff 1 comes back out of the
bathroom and bends down to wipe her shoe. While Staff 1 is bent
over, Youth A can be seen hitting Staff 1 in the head. Staff 1
stands and lunges into the bathroom with her arms raised in front
of her body. It is unable to be seen what happens in the
bathroom. Staff 2 comes into the medication room and
approaches the bathroom door. Staff 2 stands in the doorway and
then enters the bathroom. Staff 2’s head comes out of the
bathroom and then back in. Staff 4 comes into the medication
room doorway and then leaves. Staff 1 comes out of the
bathroom and stands in the doorway. Staff 1 takes the box and
leaves the medication room. Staff 2 and Youth A come out of the
bathroom.
Documents Reviewed:
• Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribal Police Incident Number
2302260031 dated 2/27/2023: Youth A reported she was
choked by staff. Youth A reported Staff 1 assaulted her
causing a cut on her forehead and bump on her head. The
police report was consistent with Youth A’s interview.
• Youth Opportunity Employee Handbook Standards of
Conduct: Staff are always expected to maintain ethical and
professional behavior. Staff are to interact with youth in a
manner promoting their emotional and physical safety while
incorporating trauma responsive practices.
• Safe Crisis Management Evasion/ Deflection trains staff to
pivot (a technique in which staff moves out of harm’s way
10

through a defensive maneuver) and parry (an arm motion
that coincides with the pivot to deflect a punch.
• Youth Opportunity Incident Report dated 2/26/2023: Youth
A came into the medication room where Staff 1 was. Youth
A was cussing and went into an unauthorized bathroom
and slammed the door. Staff 1 opened the bathroom door
and was able to remove items from the bathroom. Youth A
splashed water in Staff 1’s face. Youth A squirted lotion
and hand sanitizer at and on Staff 1. Staff 1 removed the
hand sanitizer and lotion from Youth A. Staff 1 bent down
to clean off the lotion from her leg and shoe, Youth A began
punching Staff 1 in the back of the head. Staff 1 stood up
and Youth A continued to try to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 blocked
Youth A’s hits and attempted to move to initiate an upper
torso. Youth A tripped backwards over the toilet. Staff 1
attempted to catch Youth A as she fell. Youth A fell
backwards into a laying position on the toilet and hit her on
the toilet tank. Youth A was making statements she was
assaulted by Staff 1 and that she was going to “beat your
ass bitch.” Staff 1 initiated a standing upper torso and was
calling for staff assistance to be switched out of the
restraint. Staff 2 came to assist and attempted to verbally
de-escalate Youth A. Staff 1 was trying to release the
restraint however Youth A continued moving her arms in an
assaultive manner at staff. Staff 1 was able to release and
block her arms and exit the bathroom.
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Behavior
Motivation System (iChoose): A behavior motivation system
designed to maintain order and security fostering
compliance with the program rules teaching youth
alternative pro-social methods of dealing with problems
using both rewards and a system of progressive discipline.
• Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 received Safe Crisis
Management training on 2/4/2022 and iChoose System:
Behavior Management training on 6/15/2022. Staff 1 did
not have any discipline in her personnel file related to
restraints.
• My Michigan Medical Center Mount Pleasant After Visit
Summary dated 3/1/2023: reason for visit was victim of
assault. Diagnoses: victim of assault, contusion of multiple
sites of right lower extremity, contusion of both upper
extremities, closed head injury. Imaging tests completed
included a CT head or brain without contract.
11

• Fourteen incident reports from January 1, 2023, to March
13, 2023 involving law enforcement contact: two calls for
youth self-harming behaviors, three calls for AWOLP, one
call for property destruction, three calls for youth assaulting
staff, one call made by a youth, and four calls for youth
assaulting peers.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on staff and youth
interviews, it is unclear what happened in the bathroom as the
camera footage does not show in the bathroom.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the agency address staff professionalism
regarding swearing in the workplace. During interviews youth and
staff indicated staff have sworn in front of youth.
CONSULTATION:
It is recommended the agency ensure the bathroom door in the
medication room is closed and locked at all times to ensure youth
are not able to get into the bathroom if the facility does not want
youth in this bathroom and there are items the youth should not
have access to.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(d) Staff must complete refresher training annually or more
frequently as needed.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff was not current on annual SCM training.
Investigation The complainant is this consultant as during review of Staff 1’s
training record it was noted Staff 1 received SCM training on
2/4/2022.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention Training Policy:
Each employee subject to SCM training requirements shall
12

complete a refresher course taught by a certified instructor.
SCM recertification is a 6-hour requirement annually.
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center In-Service
Training Policy and Procedure states annual training is
defined as training completed every year within 30 days of
last certification date.
• Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 received Safe Crisis
Management training on 2/4/2022.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as staff must complete
